title: Leading Democratic Voice Says Trade Vote Isn't A Done Deal
teaser: Rep. Chris Van Hollen voted against a key measure in the Trans Pacific Partnership, possibly derailing President Obama's deal. Why?
contentencoded:
Rep. Chris Van Hollen, a top Democratic Congressman from Maryland, voted against aÂ key measure in the Trans Pacific Partnership deal, possibly derailing President Obama’s trade legislation. Why? He speaks with Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson.

Guest

  • Chris Van Hollen, congressman representing Maryland’s 8th district. He tweets @ChrisVanHollen.
